titleStmt.title: The State of Indiana v. Thomas Fitzmorris, Judgment
CWG1059

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p: Be it remembered that at a term of the Allen Circuit Court began and held at the Court House in the County of Allen in the 10th Judicial Circuit of the State of Indiana, commencing on the 9th day of November A. D. 1863; before the Honorable James A. Day Judge pro tem of said Court; for appointment of Honorable Edward R. Milan Judge of said Circuit; on the 1st day of December 1863, the same being the day of said term of said Court the following proceedings were had amongst others,

State of Indiana.
vs } Grand Larceny
Thomas Fitzmorris

Comes now James H. Schull Esq. prosecutor of the pleas of the State in this behalf and now causes Moses Jenkinson the Attorney of said defendant and the motion for a new trial heretofore made in this behalf is by the Court overruled, to which ruling of the Court said defendant by his said attorney excepts.

It is therefore ordered by the Court
that said defendant ^Thomas Fitzmorris^ make his bail unto the State of Indiana in the sum of Fifty Dollars, and that said defendant be confined in the Penitentiary of the State of Indiana, at hard labor for the time of time of four years and that the said defendant stand committed to the custody of the Sheriff of Allen County to be by him as soon as convienent conveyed to the Penitentiary of the State of Indiana, and the Sheriff of Allen County is charged with the execution of this sentence.
It is further ordered by the Court that the State of Indiana have and receive of and from said defendant his costs and charges in this behalf expended --
It is further ordered that a warrant issue forthwith for the arrest of said defendant.
Wm T Pratt on his oath says that the defendant Thomas Fitzmorris since has fled the Justice of the state of Indiana, and taken refuge in the state of Kentucky, as he is informed and believes
Sworn to and subscribed before me this 4th day of Feby 1864

State of Indiana
Allen County Ss.

I, William Fleming Clerk of the Allen Circuit Court hereby certify the above and foregoing to be a full, true, perfect and camplete copy of the Judgement in the above entitled cause, wherein The State of Indiana is plaintiff and Thomas Fitzmorris is defendant as the same remains at file and of record in my office --
Witness by hand and the seal of said Court this 3d day of January 1864.
